description: Lenart Kova, after careful review, decides to restore and release a suppressed audit log capturing years of systematic erasure under the BCI. He prepares the files and hands them to trusted assembly techs.
The hidden audit log is released citywide, shocking assemblies and citizens with evidence of lost people and erased events under Halden’s BCI administration.
Assemblies organize recovery teams as emotional accounts and forgotten histories resurface, fueling debates and revisiting past injustices.
Heated arguments break out: some call for deleting all BCI data; others insist on preserving records for future justice and accountability.
Facing overwhelming public demand, the Council surrenders control of city archives. An independent assembly sets a new process for civic memory and reconciliation.
